Description:
| **Default** ``127.0.0.1``
| The IP address on which the the API server will listen

| **Default** ``52428800``
| The maximum size in bytes of the request body when Content-Type is application/json

| **Default** ``52428800``
| The maximum size in bytes of the file uploaded with Content-Type multipart/form-data

| **Default** ``1000``
| API rate limit per 15 minutes

| **Default** ``8086``
| The TCP port on which the server will listen

| **Default** ``U``
| Sets the classification banner, if any. Available values: ``NONE`` ``U`` ``FOUO`` ``CUI`` ``C`` ``S`` ``TS`` ``SCI``

| **Default** ``api``
| The base URL for Client requests to the API relative to the sever root at /

| **Default** ``../client/dist/browser``
| The location of the web client files, relative to the API source directory. Note that if running source from a clone of the GitHub repository, the client is located at `../client/dist/browser` relative to the API directory.

| **Default** ``false``
| Whether to *not* serve the reference web client

| **No default**
| OAuth2 scopes to request in addition to ``c-pat:read`` ``c-pat:write`` ``c-pat:op`` ``openid``. Some OIDC providers (Okta) generate a refresh token only if the scope ``offline_access`` is requested

| **Default** ``c-pat``
| The OIDC clientId for C-PAT

| **No default**
| String used as a prefix for each scope when authenticating to the OIDC Provider. Some providers (Azure AD) expect scope requests in the format ``api://<application_id>/<scope>``, where ``api://<application_id>/`` is the required prefix.

| **Default** ``false``
| Whether the web client should use a provided refresh token to update the access token

| **Default** ``localhost``
| The database hostname or IP from to the API server

| **Default** ``25``
| The maximum size of the database connection pool

| **Default** ``cpat``
| The user account used to login to the database

| **No default**
| The password used to login to the database

| **Default** ``3306``
| The database TCP port relative to the API server

| **Default** ``cpat``
| The schema where the C-PAT object is found

| **No default**
| A file/path relative to the API /tls directory that contains the PEM encoded CA certificate used to sign the database TLS certificate. Setting this variable enables TLS connections to the database.

| **No default**
| A file/path relative to the API /tls directory that contains the PEM encoded Client certificate used when authenticating the database client. Additionally requires setting values for ``CPAT_DB_TLS_CA_FILE`` and ``CPAT_DB_TLS_KEY_FILE``.

| **No default**
| A file/path relative to the API /tls directory that contains the PEM encoded Client private key used when authenticating the database client. Additionally requires setting values for ``CPAT_DB_TLS_CA_FILE`` and ``CPAT_DB_TLS_CERT_FILE``.

| **Default** ``./docs``
| The location of the documentation files, relative to the API source directory. Note that if running source from a clone of the GitHub repository, the docs are located at `../../docs/_build/html` relative to the API directory.

| **Default** ``false``
| Whether to *not* serve the documentation.

| **Default** ``3``
| Controls the granularity of the generated log output, from 1 to 4. Each level is inclusive of the ones before it. Level 1 will log only errors, level 2 includes warnings, level 3 includes status and transaction logs, and level 4 includes debug-level logs

| **Default** ``combined``
| Controls whether the logs will create one “combined” log entry for http requests that includes both the request and response information; or two separate log entries, one for the request and one for the response, that can be correlated via a generated Request GUID in each entry

| **Default** ``email``
| The access token claim whose value is the user's email address

| **Default** ``name``
| The access token claim whose value is the user's full name

| **Default** ``given_name``
| The access token claim whose value is the user's first name

| **Default** ``family_name``
| The access token claim whose value is the user's last name

| **Default** ``realm_access.roles``
| The access token claim whose value is the user’s privileges

| **Default** ``scope``
| The access token claim whose value is the user's scopes. Some OIDC Providers (Okta, Azure AD) use the claim ``scp`` to enumerate scopes

| **Default** ``clientId``
| The access token claim whose value is the user's client

| **Default** ``preferred_username``
| The access token claim whose value is the user's username

| **Default** ``http://localhost:8080/auth/realms/RMFTools``
| The base URL of the OIDC provider issuing signed JWTs for the API.  The string ``/.well-known/openid-configuration`` will be appended when fetching metadata.

| **Default** ``CPAT_OIDC_PROVIDER``
| Client override of the base URL of the OIDC provider issuing signed JWTs for the API.  The string ``/.well-known/openid-configuration`` will be appended when fetching metadata.

| **Default** ``false``
| Whether to enable the SwaggerUI SPA at /api-docs

| **Default** ``http://localhost:8086/api-docs/oauth2-redirect.html``
| The redirect URL sent by SwaggerUI to the OIDC provider when authorizing

| **Default** ``http://localhost:8086/api``
| The API server URL relative to the SwaggerUI

| **Default** ``stig-manager``
| The OIDC clientId for STIG Manager

| **Default** ``http://localhost:54000/api``
| The API server URL for STIG Manager

| **No default**
| String used as a prefix for each scope when authenticating to the OIDC Provider. Some providers (Azure AD) expect scope requests in the format ``api://<application_id>/<scope>``, where ``api://<application_id>/`` is the required prefix.

| **No default**
| OAuth2 scopes to request in addition to ``stig-manager:stig`` ``stig-manager:stig:read`` ``stig-manager:collection`` ``stig-manager:user`` ``stig-manager:user:read`` ``stig-manager:op`` ``openid``. Some OIDC providers (Okta) generate a refresh token only if the scope ``offline_access`` is requested

| **Default** ``false``
| API proxying for Tenable enabled.

| **No default**
| The URL for Tenable.sc. No trailing slash required.

| **No default**
| The access key provided by Tenable for API access.

| **No default**
| The secret key provided by Tenable for API access.

| **Default** ``false``
| Disabled C-PAT theme marketplace feature.

| **Default** ``false``
| By default, AI integration will be disabled. Set to ``true`` to enable.

| **No default**
| Valid options include: ``anthropic`` ``openai`` ``gemini`` ``mistral`` ``groq`` ``xai`` ``togetherai`` ``cohere`` ``fireworks`` ``cerebras`` ``perplexity`` ``deepinfra``

| **No default**
| Underlying AI integration is enabled by Vercel AI SDK. For precise model naming instructions, please visit the `Vercel docs <https://sdk.vercel.ai/providers/ai-sdk-providers/openai>`_.

| **No default**
| The API key for your chosen AI provider. This is not applicable when using ollama.

| **Default** ``http://localhost:11434``
| URL prefix for API calls to ollama.
